name: excursively
content:
excursively adverb
(WRITE OR TALK)
Add to word list
Add to word list
If someone reads, writes, or speaks excursively, they move away from the main subject and read or talk about something else: Users of the website tend to read excursively, which can cause comprehension problems. I used to pick up books at random and read them excursively. Synonym
digressively
More examplesFewer examplesThe essay seems to be composed of information excursively gathered up and stuck together.The subject is studied excursively, with the aim of collecting general information rather than gaining a deep understanding. I have read only rather excursively about the matter.

excursively adverb
(MOVE)
biology
  literary or specialized in a way that moves away from the usual direction or place, or in many different directions: The child wandered excursively, sometimes behind his mother, and at other times in front. I hiked for several days, sometimes excursively, and at other times pursuing the direct course of a river or a road.
